alert.note: Alert for Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Delaware...including the following county...Kent. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding can be expected across portions of the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have already fallen. An additional 0.5 to 1.0 inch is anticipated. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover, Camden, Woodside, Hazlettville, Dover Speedway, Rising Sun, Rising Sun-Lebanon, Dover Base Housing, Wyoming, Rodney Village, Highland Acres, and Woodside East. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
